data.title: Best Chinese food in the area
data.text: I absolutely LOVE this place. It's tucked away on first street and probably one of Duluth's best kept secrets. Food is amazing, prices are amazing, and the service rocks. Love going here!!!!

data.title: A great Chinese food experience.
data.text: I stop here every time I'm in Duluth. Old school, wonderful family restaurant in business since the '70s. Don't let the retro digs scare you when you walk in. This place is legit.

data.title: Excellent food every time
data.text: Me and my mother have eaten at the Catonese House a handful of times this past year and in years past. Every time we dine here it does not disappoint. The flavor and quality of the food consistently rates excellent from the fried rice to the egg foo young & schezuan chicken, just to name a few. The service has always been top notch each time we've dined here. The restaurant is also one of the older Chinese cuisine restaurants in Duluth. I would highly  recommend it.

data.title: Cantonese House
data.text:
Lots of food, great service, priced right.
The atmosphere was very quaint.  Our food came out before we could blink.  The food taste wonderful and fresh.

data.title: Mediocre food with small portions..expensive delivery for nearby neighborhoods.
data.text:
I ordered a delivery and was advised a  $4 delivery fee tacked onto my food bill.  That was ok with me but  when the older Asian looking driver arrived he claimed he was not given any delivery  money so  I tipped him another $2..sucker effect).  My residence is less than a mile from this restaurant.  The food was mediocre with small portions. 
My order:
no msg/low salt: cashew chicken 1 quart (which only includes white rice) nothing else
                                          2 vegetable egg rolls
                                           1 order of vegetable egg foo  
Total charge:  $29  (included the $4 delivery fee and the 
$2 tip to the delivery person)
I will not order here again unless the food quality model changes

data.title: Waited 21/2 hours for takeout
data.text: I ordered food for delivery at 5:30 and was told it would take 45 min to one hour. My husband called at 7:15 and it had just left the restaurant. It arrived at 8:00, 1 1/2 hours late. Hungry family not happy!

data.title: Love this place!
data.text: My favorite Chinese restaurant in Duluth. Always order the sweet and sour chicken, pork fried rice, cream cheese wontons and an egg roll. Never had a bad meal and I've been coming here for at least 20 years.

data.title: Excellent food
data.text: I've been eating at the Cantonese House for over 40 years, and they have the best egg rolls that I have ever had. My favorite entree is the egg foo young, but I also like the other dishes. The owners are very nice and although the atmosphere is not what a lot of people like; I have never thought that as important as the food a restaurant serves. Restaurant is always clean. Highly recommend.

data.title: best ham egg fu young ever
data.text: ham egg fu young and chicken fried rice!!!!!!! Ive been ordering it for 40 years!! so when I visit eating here is a must!!!

data.title: Great little place!
data.text: This is a must for us whenever we are in Duluth.  The Cantonese House has the best wontons, sweet and sour shrimp, as well as their chicken chop suey and chow mein.  Eggrolls are a special treat and the rice is always fluffy.  Great tea, excellent portions, and reasonable prices.

data.title: Dive in!
data.text: Ok - its a dive. jes saying... But the food is good! The BEST eggrolls I've had in Duluth. Very reasonable price and obscene amounts of food. Super nice people too.

data.title: Tucked away on first street- best egg foo yung
data.text: This place has been in the same family for over 40 years!  The prices are very reasonable, portions are generous, and their tea is the best! It's tiny in there, dated, but to me, that just adds to its charm.

data.title: Fresh and different
data.text:
I started to walk around the downtown looking for a place for dinner.  Did sushi for lunch in the Holiday Inn skywalk area (ok), so I wanted something different.  The pizza places were packed with  kids and I spotted this glowing neon sign.  So I took the gamble.  Opening the door, I see the orange decor straight from the 60's.  Tables, chairs, booths and a counter.  The counter had the stool tops removed and wooden stools placed over them; interesting!  At least there were 3 tables of customers.  The very pleasant waitress explained everything was made from scratch, nothing frozen.  Ok, I'm; to tired to run, let's roll the dice.  I ordered the hot and sour soup to start and the main meal would be orange chicken with house fried rice.  I get my pop and wait, and wait.  Being paranoid from the night before when my waitress forgot my salad; I asked her if it was coming.  She replied since it is home made, it will take a while.  Soon there after the soup came.  It looked like egg drop soup with vegetables.  It was tasty and very fresh.  I liked it, but didn't think it was hot and sour soup, till the waitress told me it was.  Must be the Canton Minnesota version.  Then I waited a little long, and was informed they cannot make a pint of house fried rice, only a quart.  I change to the veggie rice.  It call came shortly after that.
The chicken was cooked perfectly and tasty.  Not over powering with orange taste, but ok.  The rice was good.  I had asked for hot mustard with the meal.  I received a small cup of it.  When I asked for more, she told me the cook had to make more for me.  She then got me a few more cups.  There was plenty to eat and average for taste.   It was an adventure.

data.title: Terrible!!!
data.text: The pineapple chicken had no pineapple in it, it was just a bunch of GREASY chicken balls. The szechwan chicken had no spice at all and tasted like bland chicken noodle soup. They charged us dinner prices at lunch time (for the same quantities). And when we called to complain they said they wouldn't fix the pineapple chicken and that all they could do was give us a credit. Who wants a credit to somewhere they never want to eat again?? All in all we spent $30 on 2 lunches and had to throw most of it away because we couldn't even force it down. Would rate it a ZERO if the software would let me.

data.title: I've had much better chinese food elsewhere.. the orange chicken was made of orange marmalade, ick! Disappointing.
data.text: I've had much better chinese food elsewhere.. the orange chicken was made of orange marmalade, ick! Disappointing.
